title: Kannada (language): Jayanth Kaikini has mesmerized us with his lyrics a thousand times already. What are the best lines penned by him? - Quora

response.answer_text: Jayanth Kaikini has to be the most original, creative, playful lyricists that I’ve listened to. The only lyricist that I can compare him with is Gulzar. Such is the quality and originality of his writing. Lyrics in Kannada songs have traditionally been plagued by cliches. And then came this man. Ears of Kannada listeners were treated to a kind of freshness that they never before had experienced. Below, I’ve listed some lines I found great beauty in. They are in no particular order. I purposely didn’t group them into their respective movies. I thought that would lessen the reader’s focus on the lines. Of course there are many more lines of his that I love, but unfortunately they don’t come to mind right now. I may add them as and when I remember or come across. I suggest you read them the way you read a poem. Reading them with the tune of the song might dilute their effect and beauty. ನಿನ್ನ ಕಣ್ಣಿಗಂತು ನಾನು ನಿರುಪಯೋಗಿ ಈಗಲೂ ಇನ್ನು ಬೇರೆ ಏನು ಬೇಕು ಪ್ರೇಮಯೋಗಿ ಆಗಲುಪರವಶನಾದೆನು ಅರಿಯುವ ಮುನ್ನವೇ ಪರಿಚಿತನಾಗಲಿ ಹೇಗೆ ಪ್ರಣಯಕು ಮುನ್ನವೇಹೂ ಅರಳುವ ಸದ್ದನು ನಿನ್ನ ನಗೆಯಲಿ ಕೇಳಬಲ್ಲೆನನ್ನ ಏಕಾಂತವನ್ನು ತಿದ್ದಿ ಕೊಡು ನೀನೀಗ ನಿಂತಲ್ಲೇತುಟಿಯಲ್ಲಿಯೇ ಮುಚ್ಚಿಟ್ಟುಕೊ ಮುತ್ತೊಂದನು ಕದಿಯುವ ಮುನ್ನವೇನಾನು ಪ್ರೇಮರೋಗಿ ದಯಮಾಡಿ ವಾಸಿ ಮಾಡಬೇಡಿನನ್ನ ಕನಸಿನಲ್ಲಿ ದಯಮಾಡಿ ಪಾಲು ಕೇಳಬೇಡಿನಗೆಯಲ್ಲಿದೆ ಆ ಬಗೆಯಲ್ಲಿದೆ ಬಗೆಹರಿಯದ ಆ ಅವಲೋಕನಹೋದೆ ನಾನು ಕಳೆದು ದಯಮಾಡಿ ಪತ್ತೆ ಮಾಡಬೇಡಿಕಣ್ಣಲ್ಲಿ ನೀರಂತೆ ನೀನು ಇರುವಾಗ ನನ್ನೊಂದಿಗೆ ನಾ ನಿಂತು ನೋಡೋದು ಯಾರಿಗೆನೂರಾರು ರಾಗ ಮೂಕ ಪ್ರೀತಿಗೆಒಲೆಯಲ್ಲಿ ಕಾವಂತೆ ನೀನು ಇರುವಾಗ ನನ್ನೊಂದಿಗೆ ಈ ಜೀವ ಬೇಯೋದು ಯಾರಿಗೆನೀರಲ್ಲಿ ಅಲೆಯಂತೆ ನೀನು ಇರುವಾಗ ನನ್ನೊಂದಿಗೆ ತಂಗಾಳಿ ಬೀಸೋದು ಯಾರಿಗೆಇನ್ನೆಲ್ಲಿ ನನಗೆ ಉಳಿಗಾಲನಾನಿನ್ನ ಕನಸಿಗೆ ಚಂದಾದಾರನು ಚಂದಾ ಬಾಕಿ ನೀಡಲು ಬಂದೇಬರುವೆನುಹೇಳಿ ಕೇಳಿ ಮೊದಲೇ ಚೂರುಪಾಪಿ ನಾನುಕಣ್ಣ ಕೊರೆದು ದೋಚಿಕೊಂಡ ನೆನಪುಗಳಿಗೆ ಪಾಲುದಾರನನ್ನ ಈ ವೇದನೆ ನಿನಗೆ ನಾ ನೀಡೆನು ಹೇಳಿ ಕೇಳಿ ಮೊದಲೇ ಚೂರು ಕಳ್ಳ ನಾನುಎಷ್ಟು ಚಂದ ಶಿಕ್ಷೆ ಒಂದು ಸಣ್ಣ ತಪ್ಪಿಗೆವಿರಹ ಚೂಪು ಕೇದಿಗೆಸದಾ ಹೂ ಬಿಡುವ ಕಾಲ ನನ್ನ ಪ್ರೀತಿಗೆಬಹಳ ಮುದ್ದು ನಿನ್ನ ಮಾತಿನಲ್ಲಿ ವಿಷಯಾಂತರಆಸೆ ನನಗೆ ಉಸಿರಿನಲ್ಲೇ ಮಾಲೆ ಕಟ್ಟಲುಎಷ್ಟು ಪಕಳೆಯುಂಟು ಹೇಳು ಸೇವಂತಿಗೆ ಅಷ್ಟೇ ಬಗೆಯ ಸೆಳೆತ ನನಗೆ ನಿನ್ನೊಂದಿಗೆಹಿಗ್ಗಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಅರಳಿ ನಿನ್ನ ಮುಖವೇ ದಾಸವಾಳವು ಮತ್ತೆ ಮತ್ತೆ ಚಿಟ್ಟೆ ಹಾರಿಬಂದು ಮೋಸ ಹೋದವುಗುಟ್ಟು ಮಾಡುವಾಗ ನೀನು ದಿಟ್ಟ ಕಣಗಿಲೆ ತೊಟ್ಟು ಜೇನಿಗಾಗಿ ನಿನ್ನ ಮುಂದೆ ಕುಣಿಯಲೆನಿನ್ನ ಸ್ವಪ್ನ ಕಂಡೆ ನಿನ್ನ ಎದೆಗೆ ವೊರಗಿಯೇ

Wow, what a wonderful question! How blissful has it been to read other answers and how blissful will it be to write my own! There are very few things I hold dearer than my Jayant Kaikini favourites playlist, which can cater to each and every minute point that exists on the happiness-sadness mood spectrum. I jumped in joy like a kid on seeing the question and couldn’t wait to chip in. So here it goes, some of the lines which I think are his best!  1) ಏನೋ ಹೇಳಬೇಕು ಅಂದೆ - Yenu Helabeku Ande - Maleyali Joteyali Many of them have talked about ನೀ ಸನಿಹಕೆ ಬಂದರೆ from ಮಳೆಯಲಿ ಜೊತೆಯಲಿ but this is a highly underrated song from the same film which is absolutely amazing. Although I love ನೀ ಸನಿಹಕೆ ಬಂದರೆ, I’d choose ಏನೋ ಹೇಳಬೇಕು ಅಂದೆ, ಏನದು? over it any day! My favourite lines from the song: ಹೆಚ್ಚು ಕಡಿಮೆ ನಾನೀಗ, ಹುಚ್ಚನಾಗಿ ಹೋದಂತೆ, ಹಚ್ಚಿಕೊಂಡ ಮೇಲೆ ನಿನ್ನ (It is almost certain I have gone mad after having fallen for you) ಕಷ್ಟವಾದರೇನಂತೆ? ಸ್ಪಷ್ಟವಾಗಿ ಕೂಗು ಇಷ್ಟ ಬಂದಹಾಗೆ ನನ್ನ (What if it is difficult? Shout my name clearly and call me whatever you feel like calling) And this line! It gives goosebumps every single time I hear it. My most favourite line in any song at the moment! ನಿನ್ನ ಕಣ್ಣಿನ, ಮಿಂಚೆ ಕಲಿಸಿದೆ, ಸೀದಾ ಜೀವಕೆ ನಾಟುವ ಭಾಷೆಯ … The messages from your eyes have taught me a language which can be directly be understood by my soul  2) ನೀ ಸನಿಹಕೆ ಬಂದರೆ - Nee Sanihake Bandare - Maleyali Joteyali Enough has been said about the awesomeness of this song already. It will be a futile exercise to even try and describe its beauty in totality. It is just so good! My favourite lines from the song: ನನ್ನ ಎದೆಯ ಸಣ್ಣ ತೆರೆಯ ಧಾರಾವಾಹಿ ನಿನ್ನ ನೆನಪು (Your memories play like a serial on the screen, inside my heart) ನೆನ್ನೆ ತನಕ ಎಲ್ಲಿ ಅಡಗಿ ಇತ್ತು ನಿನ್ನ ಕಣ್ಣ ಹೊಳಪು? (Where was this spark that I see in your eyes today, till yesterday?)  3) ನಿನ್ನ ಗುಂಗಲ್ಲೇ ಚಲಿಸುವೆನು - Ninna Gungalle - Lifeu Ishtene This is yet another lesser known gem from Pawan Kumar’s debut directorial Lifeu Ishtene. It has a soulful melody to it which is difficult to get bored of, no matter how many times you listen to it. My favourite lines from the song: ಹುಡುಕಿ ನಿನ್ನನು ಕಳೆದ ನನ್ನನು, ಬರಿ ನಿನ್ನಲ್ಲೇ ಅರಸುವೆನು (I will search myself, which I lost while searching for you, in your world) ನಿನ್ನ ವಿಶ್ರಾಂತಿ ಕೆಡಿಸುವೆನು (And consume all your leisure)  4) ನಾ ನಗುವ ಮೊದಲೇನೆ - Naa Naguva Modalene - Manasaare Manasaare had a wonderful album like almost all of Diganth’s films. It is amazing how Jayant Kaikini can give equally amazing lyrics from the female point of view. Shreya Ghoshal, as always, has done full justice to the song. My favourite lines from the song: ತಿಳಿಸದೆ ನನಗೆ ಹುಡುಕಿದೆ ನಿನ್ನ, ನನ್ನಯ ಕಣ್ಣು My eyes have started searching for you even without informing me ಸಿಹಿ ಸಂಕಟ ಸಾಕಾಗಿದೆ ಮುಂದೇನು? I am fed up of this lovely trouble, what next? ಕಲಿತಿದೆ ಮನವು ಕುಣಿಯುವುದನ್ನು, ಕಂಡರೆ ನೀನು My mind has started to dance every time it spots you ನಾನು ನನ್ನ ಪಾಡಿಗಿರಲು, ಯಾಕೆ ಕಂಡೆ ನೀ ನನಗೆ? I was minding my own business. Why did you appear in my life?  5) ನಿನ್ನಯಾ ನಲುಮೆಯ ಲೋಕಕೆ - Ninnaya Nalumeya Lokake - Pancharangi Pancharangi has two beautiful songs with the same music, a male and a female version each. While the male versions are more popular, as is always the case with such Kaikini song-pairs, I like the female versions even more. ನಿನ್ನಯಾ ನಲುಮೆಯ ಲೋಕಕೆ > ಉಡಿಸುವೆ ಬೆಳಕಿನ ಸೀರೆಯ. My favourite lines from the song: ನೀ ಭೇಟಿಯಾದಂತ ಯಾವುದೇ ಜಾಗ, ಜೀವದ ಭಾಗ, ಎಂದೆಂದಿಗೂ Every place where we have ever met will forever be a part of my life ನೀನಿಲ್ಲದ ಯಾವ ಸ್ವಪ್ನವು ಕೂಡ, ಬೇಡವೇ ಬೇಡ, ಈ ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೂ My eyes don’t ever want to get any dreams in which you don’t feature  6) ಮಳೆ ನಿಂತು ಹೋದಮೇಲೆ - Male Nintu Hoda Mele - Milana Milana and Mungaru Male marked the resurgence of Kannada film music and lyrics in a grand style. About 6–8 songs from both these films have an everlasting place both in our hearts and playlists even after a decade. One such gem is this amazing song from Milana. My favourite lines from the song: ಮಳೆ ನಿಂತು ಹೋದಮೇಲೆ ಹನಿಯೊಂದು ಮೂಡಿದೆ A raindrop has formed after the downpour ಮಾತೆಲ್ಲ ಮುಗಿದ ಮೇಲೆ ದನಿಯೊಂದು ಕಾಡಿದೆ A voice has emerged after all our talks are over ಹೇಳುವುದು ಏನೋ ಉಳಿದುಹೋಗಿದೆ But something I wanted to say has remained with myself ಹೇಳಲಿ ಹೇಗೆ, ತಿಳಿಯದಾಗಿದೆ And I am not able to find out how to convey the same And this! ಎದೆಯ ದೂರವಾಣಿಯ ಕರೆಯ ರಿಂಗಣ ಕೇಳು ಜೀವವೇ, ಏತಕೀ ಕಂಪನ? Oh soul, why are you hesitating to answer your heart’s call? ಹೃದಯವು ಇಲ್ಲೆ ಕಳೆದುಹೋಗಿದೆ, ಹುಡುಕಲೇ ಬೇಕೇ ತಿಳಿಯದಾಗಿದೆ My heart is now lost somewhere. Should I find it at all?  7) ಇವನು ಗೆಳೆಯನಲ್ಲ - Ivanu Geleyanalla - Mungaru Male This is by far the best female perspective song I have come across in recent times, and almost every girl I know loves this song more than any other. Mungaru Male has two terrific female PoV songs and it comes as no surprise that both are penned by the legend. My favourite lines from the song: ತಿಳಿದು ತಿಳಿದು ಇವನು ತನ್ನ ತಾನೇ ಸೋತಿಹನಲ್ಲ He has knowingly lost himself ಒಲುಮೆ ಎಂಬ ಸುಳಿಗೆ ಈಜು ಬರದೆ ಇಳಿದಿಹನಲ್ಲ And entered the whirlpool of love even without knowing to swim ಸಾವಿನಲ್ಲೂ ನಗುವುದ ಬಲ್ಲ, ಏನೋ ಕಳವಳ! He is laughing even when he is about to drown in it ಮುಳುಗುವವನ ಕೂಗು, ಚಾಚುವಂತೆ ಮಾಡಿದೆ ಕೈಯಾ His calls for rescue has almost made me extend my helping hand ಜಾರಿಬಿಡುವುದೇ ಹೃದಯ, ಏನೋ ತಳಮಳ! But I am worried if my heart will also slip, if I do so  8) ನೀರಲ್ಲಿ ಸಣ್ಣ ಅಲೆಯೊಂದು ಮೂಡಿ - Neeralli Sanna - Hudugaru The song leans towards the sad side on the happiness-sadness spectrum and I have to say Jayant Kaikini is a master at this side of the spectrum. My favourite lines from the song: ನೀರಲ್ಲಿ ಸಣ್ಣ ಅಲೆಯೊಂದು ಮೂಡಿ ಚೂರಾದ ಚಂದ್ರನೀಗ A wave has formed in the water and shattered the moon’s reflection in it ಅಲ್ಲೊಂದು ಚೂರು ಇಲ್ಲೊಂದು ಚೂರು ಒಂದಾಗಬೇಕು ಬೇಗ One piece of it here, and another there, the moon should become one again! And this! ಎದೆಯಾಳದಿಂದ ಮಧುಮೌನವೊಂದು ಕರೆವಾಗ ಜಂಟಿಯಾಗಿ When the inner silence deep within our hearts is calling us both together ಇಲ್ಲೊಂದು ಜೀವ ಅಲ್ಲೊಂದು ಜೀವ ಇರಬೇಕೆ ಒಂಟಿಯಾಗಿ? Should we still remain separate at all?  9) ಅರಳುತಿರು ಜೀವದ ಗೆಳೆಯ - Aralutiru Jeevada Geleya - Mungaru Male This is the female version of perhaps modern Kannada cinema’s most popular ever song, ಅನಿಸುತಿದೆ ಯಾಕೋ ಇಂದು. While the male version is a lot more lively, refreshing and romantic, the female version is deep and realistically sad. What a fantastic song nevertheless. My favourite lines from the song: ಹಕ್ಕಿಯು ಹಾಡಿದೆ ತನ್ನ ಹೆಸರನೂ ಹೇಳದೆ; ಸಂಪಿಗೆ ಬೀರಿದೆ ಕಂಪನು ಯಾರಿಗೂ ಕೇಳದೆ Bird is chirping even without telling its name. Jasmine has lent its fragrance even without letting anybody know ಬೀಸುವ ಗಾಳಿಯ ಹಕ್ಕಿಯ ಹಾಡಿನ ನಂಟಿಗೆ ಹೆಸರಿನ ಹೊಂಗಿಲ್ಲ, ನಮಗೇಕೆ ಅದರ ಯೋಚನೆ? When there’s no name for the pleasant relationship between the bird’s chirping and jasmine’s fragrance, why should we bother about finding a name for ours? ಬೇಡ ಗೆಳೆಯ ನಂಟಿಗೆ ಹೆಸರು, ಯಾಕೆ ಸುಮ್ಮನೆ? Let us not give any name for our relationship, why is it even required? And this! ಬಾಳ ದಾರಿಯಲಿ ಬೇರೆಯಾದರೂ ಚಂದಿರ ಬರುವನು ನಮ್ಮ ಜೊತೆ Even if we go our separate ways in life, moon will come along ಕಾಣುವೆನು ಅವನಲಿ ನಿನ್ನನೆ I will see you in the moon, everyday of my life  10) ಅನಿಸುತಿದೆ ಯಾಕೋ ಇಂದು - Anisutide Yaako Indu - Mungaru Male This is hands down the most popular song of 21st century Kannada cinema. There’s nothing that hasn’t been said before about this marvellous song, so I won’t get to it. My favourite lines from the song: ತುಟಿಗಳ ಹೂವಲಿ ಆಡದ ಮಾತಿನ ಸಿಹಿಯಿದೆ My lips have the sweetness of a thousand words which I haven’t yet told you ಮನಸಿನ ಪುಟದಲಿ ಪ್ರೇಮದ ನಿನ್ನದೇ ಸಹಿಯಿದೆ My heart has a lovely autograph of yours, my love ಹಣೆಯಲಿ ಬರೆಯದ ನಿನ್ನ ಹೆಸರ ಹೃದಯದಿ ನಾನೇ ಕೊರೆದಿರುವೆ, ನಿನಗುಂಟೆ ಇದರ ಕಲ್ಪನೆ? Do you even have the slightest idea that I have engraved your name on my heart even if you are not destined to be mine?  11) ಕಾಗದದ ದೋಣಿಯಲ್ಲಿ - Kaagadada Doniyalli - Kirik Party The wonderful thing about this album is how the favourite song from the album kept on changing constantly. But this song has remained my favourite for a long time now and I can’t think of any other song to hum when I am riding on a quiet, peaceful road. I am sure it is the case with many more people here! My favourite lines from the song ಹಾದಿಯಲಿ ಹೆಕ್ಕಿದ ನೆನಪಿನ ಪುಟ್ಟ ಜೋಳಿಗೆ ಬೆನ್ನಲ್ಲಿದೆ A small luggage of memories rests on my back as I embark on this journey ಆಡದಿರೊ ಸಾವಿರ ಪದಗಳ ಮೂಕ ಸೇತುವೆ ಕಣ್ಮುಂದಿದೆ And I can see a silent bridge of a thousand unsaid words in front of me  12) ಮಾತಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಹೇಳಲಾರೆನು - Maatinalli Helalarenu - Bombaat This is yet another wonderful song from the Kaikini - Sonu Nigam combo! Though Ganesh’s later films after Gaalipata mostly tanked and didn’t live up to the expectations of his first few films, the songs continued to be awesome courtesy the awesomeness of this combo. My favourite lines from the song: ನಗೆಯಲ್ಲಿದೆ ಆ ಬಗೆಯಲ್ಲಿದೆ ಬಗೆಹರಿಯದಾ ಆ ಅವಲೋಕನ In her laughter and her demeanour, there’s an unsolved contemplation ನಡೆಯಲ್ಲಿದೆ ಆ ನುಡಿಯಲ್ಲಿದೆ ತಲೆಕೆಡಿಸುವ ಆ ಆಮಂತ್ರಣ In her walk and her talk, there is a confusing invitation ಕನಸಿಗಿಂತ ಚಂದವಾಗಿ ಅಳಿಸದಂತ ಗಂಧವಾಗಿ ಮೊದಲ ಬಾರಿ ಕಂಡ ಕ್ಷಣವೇ ಬಂಧಿಯಾದೇನು I became her prisoner immediately after her first sight. It was even better than a dream, like a fragrance which can never be erased  13) ಪರವಶನಾದೆನು - Paravashanadenu - Paramaatma One of the more popular songs of Kaikini, this is sure to feature on most playlists for its sheer charm. The female version of this song, ತನ್ಮಯಳಾದೆನು, is equally good but less popular as is often the case. My favourite lines from the song: ಕನಸಲಿ ತುಂಬ ಕೆಟ್ಟಿರುವೆನು ನಿನ್ನನು ಕಾಣದೆ I am disappointed with not seeing you in my dreams ರೆಕ್ಕೆಯ ನೀನೇ ಕಟ್ಟಿರಲು ಈ ಹೃದಯವು ಹಾರಿದೆ My heart is busy flying after you tied wings to it ನನ್ನ ಕೌತುಕ ಒಂದೊಂದೇ ಹೇಳಬೇಕು I want to discuss all my musings one at a time ಆಲಿಸುವಾಗ ನೋಡು ನನ್ನನ್ನೇ ಸಾಕು Just keep looking at me while I am at it  14) ಕನಸಲೂ ನೂರು ಬಾರಿ - Kanasalu Nooru Baari - Mungaru Male 2 As is the case with sequels of popular movies, this one tanked at the box office but the need to keep the reputation of the brand meant that at least the album would be good. Among the four good songs in the film, I like this and its male version the most. My favourite lines from the song: ಈ ಕೊರಳಿಗೆ ನಿನ್ನ ಉಸಿರಿನ ಬಯಕೆಯು My neck is yearning for the feel of your breath ಮುಂಗುರುಳಿಗೆ ನಿನ್ನ ಬೆರಳಿನ ಹುಡುಕಾಟವು And the curls of my hair for the touch of your fingers ನಡೆವೆನು ಹಿಂಬಾಲಿಸಿ ನೆರಳನು ನಾ ಸೋಲಿಸಿ I will walk behind you defeating even your own shadow ಅತಿಯಾದ ಪ್ರೀತಿ ಬೇಡುವೆ ಬೆಂಬಿಡದೆ ನಿನ್ನ ಕಾಡುವೆ I will expect lots of love and trouble you till you meet my expectations  15) ಈ ಸಂಜೆ ಯಾಕಾಗಿದೆ - Ee Sanje Yaakagide - Geleya This is one of those songs after listening to which you’d want to meet Jayant Kaikini and question him for hours, days and months as to what sort of experiences have made him write so many amazing songs to which thousands and lakhs of us can relate to at different points of our lives. My favourite lines from the song: ನೀನಿಲ್ಲದೆ ಆ ಚಂದಿರ ಈ ಕಣ್ಣಲಿ ಕಸವಾಗಿದೆ The moon has become a waste without you ಅದನೂದುವ ಉಸಿರಿಲ್ಲದೆ ಬೆಳದಿಂಗಳು ಅಸುನೀಗಿದೆ The moonlight has died of suffocation, without the air it needs to breathe ಆಕಾಶದಿ ಕಲೆಯಾಗಿದೆ, ಈ ಸಂಜೆಯ ಕೊಲೆಯಾಗಿದೆ The sky has been scarred and the evening has been murdered ಈ ಗಾಯ ಹಸಿಯಾಗಿದೆ Leaving my bruise and my pain to become fresh again  There are a lot more amazing songs but I’ll stop it at fifteen for now and add a few more as and when it comes to my mind. Have a great time listening to his evergreen classics. I am sure I’ll be listening for years to come!
